instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
This arrived with very little liquid damage. After removing <CAPACITOR>C6501</CAPACITOR>-<CAPACITOR>C6503</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6405</CAPACITOR> board started to boot with 20v for a few seconds but boot looped and then was stuck at 5v.

Reviving T2 in DFU solved the 5v issue. The machine now turns on and boots into the OS. The issue is when you go to restart the machine it will not turn back on, same applies to shut down and attempt to turn back on. The battery needs to be disconnected/reconnected for it to turn back on again.

Another observation is after reconnecting the battery the master usb-c port will be stuck at 5v 0amp but all other ports will work fine however after inital power on using any other port that port works fine again at 20V.

Battery is aftermarket that was replaced by someone else. OS says its normal and passes apple diagnostic. Not sure if that could be causing this issue?

What should be tried next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
Possibly Hall sensor issue.
Check <SIGNAL>LID_OPEN_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT and <SIGNAL>IPD_LID_OPEN</SIGNAL>.
Machine comes back from suspend, when you close/open the lid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>LID_OPEN_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT and <SIGNAL>IPD_LID_OPEN</SIGNAL>  are all present 1.8v

A new observation is when the board alone is on the desk the left ports boot to 20v but the right is only 5v 0.25amps. Tried reflashing UB260 but no change

All LDOs are present on <CHIP>U3100W</CHIP>/<CHIP>U3100R</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
Check all resistors in <SIGNAL>U3100_W</SIGNAL>/R area.

Compare <SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> signal between left/right ports.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL>  is 1.8v on left and right ports.

All resistors measure good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: This is JB200 can these missing pads and trace damage around JB200 cause any issues even though JB200 is no stuff?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: JB200

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: Leakage between pads, or data lines can cause such problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: How do you fix leakage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: Cleaning affected areas...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
Affected area was cleaned and looks good.

Board now turns on using the left side usbc ports only. The right side does not work at all. Customer does not mind right side not working though.

The new issue is once the machine is shut down it will not come on again until the battery flex is unplugged and plugged back in. Using known good battery. 

What else could cause this issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>PMU_RSLOC_RST_L</SIGNAL> behavior.

Machine wakes up correctly when close/open the lid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PMU_RSLOC_RST_L</SIGNAL>  is 3.3v wether lid is closed or opened.

yes machine  wakes up correctly when close/open the lid

When battery needs to be unplugged/replugged to turn machine back on after shutting down the message your computer has restarted because of a problem message appears

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: Message after login

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
Check if any error pops up starting in diagnostic mode.
Inspect <TRANSISTOR>Q8251</TRANSISTOR> and related resistors.
Do the same for <TRANSISTOR>Q8170</TRANSISTOR>/1.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q8171</TRANSISTOR> has 3.3v on pin 1 <SIGNAL>MEM_BLDR_EN</SIGNAL> but 0v on pin 3 <SIGNAL>P1V1_BLDR_L</SIGNAL> board alone on desk.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
That is correct in off state.
What about the other MOSFETs mentioned?
Be sure the discharge resistors are good too (5.1-10 ohm).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: on the board <RESISTOR>R8255</RESISTOR> only measures 92k when it should be 100k

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: High value resistors will not give you correct reading measured onboard!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: All of the mosfets look pristine. No issues found in diagnostic mode. The issue does not occur until after the macbook has been shut down for a extended period of time

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
Then the problem is not related with mentioned MOSFETs.
The discharge circuit can cause such problem, but in the first seconds/minutes; before the controlled power rails are not completely discharged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: What do you suggest to fix that or is this kind of problem not fixable? The mentioned mosfet areas had no liquid damage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: Save data and try DFU restore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: DFU restore failed with error 4042 "gave up waiting on device to transition from dfu state to dfu state"

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: Machine still boots now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: No. Just 20v and charges the battery. No fan spin or screen activity now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
Try again DFU revive/restore.
It may work after several attempts...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: Restore completed successfully after another attempt however  board is now not powering on. During the restore process there was no screen activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message: Which coils get voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
L7030 5V L7660 3.3V L7600 5V 

All other coils are 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
This is annoying.
How can DFU make working machine unresponsive?
Apple doesn't care at all about clients.

SSD voltages come on?
Also check other G3S voltages...
